data.question: What is the molecular structure of the iron(III)-superoxo complex synthesized?
data.answer: The iron(III)-superoxo complex synthesized has a mononuclear side-on (η2) iron(III)-superoxo complex structure with a tetraamido macrocyclic ligand.

data.question: What are the key reactivities observed for the iron(III)-superoxo complex?
data.answer: The iron(III)-superoxo complex undergoes both electrophilic and nucleophilic oxidation reactions, and it can also transfer the bound O2 unit to a manganese(III) analogue.

data.question: What is the significance of the O–O bond length in determining the character of the iron(III)-superoxo complex?
data.answer: The O–O bond length in the iron(III)-superoxo complex is indicative of its superoxo character, with shorter bond lengths suggesting significant delocalization of electron density and a closer resemblance to an Fe(III)-superoxo species.

data.question: How does the electronic structure of the iron(III)-superoxo complex compare to that of the manganese(IV)-peroxo complex?
data.answer: The electronic structure of the iron(III)-superoxo complex shows significant delocalization of electron density onto the Fe, suggesting Fe(III)-superoxo character, while the manganese(IV)-peroxo complex has less delocalization of electron density onto Mn, placing it closer to the Mn(IV)-peroxo limit.

data.question: True or False: The iron(III)-superoxo complex is capable of activating the C–H bonds of hydrocarbons.
True or False: The O2-transfer from the iron(III)-superoxo complex to a Mn(III) complex results in the formation of a manganese(IV)-peroxo complex.
What method was used to determine the magnetic moment of the iron(III)-superoxo complex?
data.answer: The magnetic moment of the iron(III)-superoxo complex was determined using the 1H nuclear magnetic resonance Evans method.

data.question: What is the observed effect of para-substituents on the reaction rates of the iron(III)-superoxo complex with para-substituted 2,6-di-tert-butylphenols?
data.answer: The electronegativity of the para-substituents significantly influences the reaction rates, with a good correlation observed between the relative rates and the O–H bond dissociation energies of the substrates.

data.question: True or False: The iron(III)-superoxo complex shows a positive Hammett σ+ value in the aldehyde deformylation reaction, indicating its nucleophilic reactivity.
What computational method was used to elucidate the electronic structures of the iron(III)-superoxo and manganese(IV)-peroxo complexes?
data.answer: Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations were used to elucidate the electronic structures of the iron(III)-superoxo and manganese(IV)-peroxo complexes.
